page.title: 19TRADE
page.content: Port Glasgow's shopping and market facilities are not of a very high standard. The town centre{shops}have not got the same variety as many of the larger nearby towns e.g. Paisley and Greenock. It is for this reason that many people do travel to these larger towns for shopping or even go all the way to Glasgow. For very-day needs then either the shops in the centre will do or the local shopping areas built in the housing schemes. At present there are no{markets}in Port Glasgow. There are other{businesses}which are found in the town, most of them in the town centre. These are the usual High Street banks, Post Offices, Legal Firms and an assortment of other {trades}and businesses. Local people would like to see the shopping facilities of the town improved.
